ccre.concurrency

Class CollapsingWorkerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ccre.concurrency.ReporterThread
        • ccre.concurrency.CollapsingWorkerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventConsumer, java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class CollapsingWorkerThread
extends ReporterThread
implements EventConsumer
    A worker thread that will allow other threads to trigger a predefined action in this thread. Multiple triggerings will be collapsed into a single trigger. If the action is executed while the thread is working, and shouldIgnoreWhileRunning was not set to true in the constructor, the trigger is ignored. This is an EventConsumer - when it is fired, it will trigger this thread's work.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollapsingWorkerThread

        public CollapsingWorkerThread(java.lang.String name)
        Create a new CollapsingWorkerThread with the given name. Will ignore any triggers while the work is running.
        Parameters:
        name - the thread's name

      • CollapsingWorkerThread

        public CollapsingWorkerThread(java.lang.String name,
                      boolean shouldIgnoreWhileRunning)
        Create a new CollapsingWorkerThread with the given name. If shouldIgnoreWhileRunning is true, this will ignore any triggers while the work is running.
        Parameters:
        name - the thread's name
        shouldIgnoreWhileRunning - should the thread ignore triggers while the work is running.

    • Method Detail

      • eventFired

        public void eventFired()
        Trigger the work. When possible, the thread will run its doWork method. This method exists for using this thread as an EventConsumer. You may prefer trigger() instead, although there is no functional difference.
        Specified by:
        eventFired in interface EventConsumer
        See Also:
        trigger()

      • triggerWhen

        public void triggerWhen(EventSource event)
        When the given event is fired, trigger this thread's work as in the eventFired() method. This is equivalent to adding this object as a listener to the given EventSource.
        Parameters:
        event - when to trigger the work.
        See Also:
        eventFired()

      • trigger

        public void trigger()
        Trigger the work. When possible, the thread will run its doWork method.

      • getRunningStatus

        public BooleanInput getRunningStatus()
        Get a BooleanInput that represents whether or not this thread's work is currently running.
        Returns:
        a BooleanInput reflecting if work is happening.

      • threadBody

        protected final void threadBody()
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: ReporterThread
        The body of the thread. This will be called when the thread starts. This is guarenteed to be called precisely once by the ReporterThread.
        Specified by:
        threadBody in class ReporterThread
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • doWork

        protected abstract void doWork()
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        The implementation of the work to do when this worker is triggered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if any error occurs. this will not end the thread, but just the current execution of work.
